intro: Quararibea cruceto, commonly known as the Guayacan tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and large, elliptical leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, spiny fruits containing seeds. It is often found in lowland tropical forests and is valued for its durable wood and medicinal properties. The plant also plays an important ecological role in its native habitats.
